intro: Pimpinella thellungiana var. tenuisecta, commonly known as the slender-leafed cowparsley, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like foliage. It is a biennial or short-lived perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in early summer. Its leaves are narrow and pinnately compound, giving it a delicate, lace-like appearance. This variety is often found in moist, calcareous soils in woodland edges and meadows.
